habitat_description:
In General:
Sandy soil in valleys; firm sandy soil, overlain with pebbles, on slopes with widely spaced shrubs. In sagebrush, creosote bush, and cactus communities in Lower and Upper Sonoran life zones.

Southwest:
Found primarily on sandy and gravelly soils (Hall 1946, Ingles 1965, NMDGF 2003), but sometimes found on stony soils and rarely on rocky sites (CDFG 2003). In Nevada, occurs in the lower and upper Sonoran life zones below the pinyon-juniper growth (Hall 1946). In Arizona, north of the Colorado River, the species was taken near Page, AZ in rabbitbrush, tumble mustard (Sysymbrium
altissimum), blackbrush, sand sagebrush, Mormon tea and yucca. In southwestern Arizona south of Yuma they live in sandy soil with few plants, and these were primarily widely spread creosote bushes, dessert lilies, and verbena. In northern Mohave County, little pocket mice were the most abundant rodents in the Joshua tree, yucca, cactus and Larrea association (Hoffmeister 1986,
NMDGF 2003). Highest elevation recorded in Nevada is 6500 ft (1980 m) (Hall 1946 and Beatley 1976).
